paper_title.ja: Two-phase Multiple Regression Model with Some Order Autoregressive Processes
paper_title.en: Two-phase Multiple Regression Model with Some Order Autoregressive Processes

description.ja: The purpose of this paper is to present a two-phase multiple regression model containing some order auto-correlated error terms under a continuity constraint and to estimate the parameters and the change line of the model by a least squares method. The asymptotic distribution theory of the least squares estimators under the continuity constraint is obtained from the asymptotic property of data, making the residual sum of squares locally smooth enough to apply the classical techniques.Further, the model is applied to analyzing a set of long-term annual average temperature data inTokyo.
description.en: The purpose of this paper is to present a two-phase multiple regression model containing some order auto-correlated error terms under a continuity constraint and to estimate the parameters and the change line of the model by a least squares method. The asymptotic distribution theory of the least squares estimators under the continuity constraint is obtained from the asymptotic property of data, making the residual sum of squares locally smooth enough to apply the classical techniques.Further, the model is applied to analyzing a set of long-term annual average temperature data inTokyo.

paper_title.ja: 健康づくり事業と住民の意識に関する一考察-千葉県I市における実態調査-
paper_title.en: A Study on Public Health Programs and Residents' Health Consciousness-Based on a Survey Conducted in I city in Chiba Prefecture

description.ja: As a part of public health care service, I city in Chiba prefecture offers several health care educational programs to groups or individuals who were advised to change their lifestyles by health care professionals. These programs should be designed to satisfy the needs of the residents, however, the real need of the residents may not have been accurately reflected on the availability of programs. Therefore, we conducted a survey to evaluate the city's public health care program as compared to the demands. We have mailed questionnaire to 500 randomly selected residents, and 208 of them filled in and replied to us. Major findings in 192 women are as follows. 1. 87% of residents who returned the survey were generally in good health. 2. For sleep and rest questions, about half of them claimed they go to bed at a certain time regularly. However, about one third of them stated that they tend to stay up late or don't sleep enough time. 3. 20 to 30% of the wives who answered the survey do not like cooking, and many of them use instant or frozen food at home. In addition, families of such wives more frequently go out to eat. There needs to be a program to educated residents of the nutrition and diet as well as the meaning of home made balanced meals. 4. 30 years old in particular have not developed a habit of regular exercise. 5. About health complaints and concerns, many of them were not serious and not required immediate attention from healthcare professionals, such as signs of heat diseases or failure. Nevertheless, most of their health complains and concerns were mild, such as stiff shoulder or back pain.
description.en: As a part of public health care service, I city in Chiba prefecture offers several health care educational programs to groups or individuals who were advised to change their lifestyles by health care professionals. These programs should be designed to satisfy the needs of the residents, however, the real need of the residents may not have been accurately reflected on the availability of programs. Therefore, we conducted a survey to evaluate the city's public health care program as compared to the demands. We have mailed questionnaire to 500 randomly selected residents, and 208 of them filled in and replied to us. Major findings in 192 women are as follows. 1. 87% of residents who returned the survey were generally in good health. 2. For sleep and rest questions, about half of them claimed they go to bed at a certain time regularly. However, about one third of them stated that they tend to stay up late or don't sleep enough time. 3. 20 to 30% of the wives who answered the survey do not like cooking, and many of them use instant or frozen food at home. In addition, families of such wives more frequently go out to eat. There needs to be a program to educated residents of the nutrition and diet as well as the meaning of home made balanced meals. 4. 30 years old in particular have not developed a habit of regular exercise. 5. About health complaints and concerns, many of them were not serious and not required immediate attention from healthcare professionals, such as signs of heat diseases or failure. Nevertheless, most of their health complains and concerns were mild, such as stiff shoulder or back pain.

paper_title.ja: 大学生と若年社会人の生活習慣に関する健康意識,保健行動,自覚的身体状況の検討
paper_title.en: Report on Lifestyles and Health Consciousness, Health Behavior, Physical Status of College Students and Working Young Adults

description.ja: One's transition from a free and non-restricted college student to a working adult with various social responsibilities and time-restrictions requires various adjustments in one's daily life. It is assumed that the transitional period provides a key to one's future attitude towards healthier lifestyle and health consciousness. The purpose of this study was to investigate the meanings and importance of health education in this transitional period for a better future outcome in terms of healthy lifestyle and health consciousness. The survey was conducted on 885 male and female students from Juntendo University, 433 male and female students from T University in Chiba prefecture, and l71 male and female public service workers in Hokkaido island. The survey intends to seek on sleep and rest patterns, eating habits, exercise routine, and sanitary habits. The result supports several existing similar survey results such that females are more conscious of their health and have healthier lifestyles than males. It also points out that females tend to have more complaints about their health than males. Among the 3 groups, Juntendo University students had the healthiest lifestyles and the most conscious of their health, indicating that Juntendo students in average are in better health conditions. The survey also shows that the Juntendo University students rate themselves healthy subjectively. Comparing the T University students as an average example of students and the public service workers in Hokkaido island as an average working young adults, public service workers had better rate in many categories in the survey. This is indicating that transition from students to working adults brings better results in their attitude towards healthier lifestyle and health consciousness. As a conclusion the survey successfully supports our expectation that this transitional period is a significant stage in one's life in terms of one's future attitude towards healthy lifestyle. Therefore, health education in this transitional period is critical for a better and healthier adulthood.
description.en: One's transition from a free and non-restricted college student to a working adult with various social responsibilities and time-restrictions requires various adjustments in one's daily life. It is assumed that the transitional period provides a key to one's future attitude towards healthier lifestyle and health consciousness. The purpose of this study was to investigate the meanings and importance of health education in this transitional period for a better future outcome in terms of healthy lifestyle and health consciousness. The survey was conducted on 885 male and female students from Juntendo University, 433 male and female students from T University in Chiba prefecture, and l71 male and female public service workers in Hokkaido island. The survey intends to seek on sleep and rest patterns, eating habits, exercise routine, and sanitary habits. The result supports several existing similar survey results such that females are more conscious of their health and have healthier lifestyles than males. It also points out that females tend to have more complaints about their health than males. Among the 3 groups, Juntendo University students had the healthiest lifestyles and the most conscious of their health, indicating that Juntendo students in average are in better health conditions. The survey also shows that the Juntendo University students rate themselves healthy subjectively. Comparing the T University students as an average example of students and the public service workers in Hokkaido island as an average working young adults, public service workers had better rate in many categories in the survey. This is indicating that transition from students to working adults brings better results in their attitude towards healthier lifestyle and health consciousness. As a conclusion the survey successfully supports our expectation that this transitional period is a significant stage in one's life in terms of one's future attitude towards healthy lifestyle. Therefore, health education in this transitional period is critical for a better and healthier adulthood.
